actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Senate Committee on Environment and Public Works discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 235 proposed by Senator Mitchell for Senator Burdick.
Amendment SP 235 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Anderson asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendments.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-53.

official_title: To authorize the exchange of certain Federal public land in Madison County, Illinois.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the Army to exchange certain Federal land in Madison County, Illinois, for certain land in that county owned by the Blue Tee Corporation. Subjects the exchange of such land to conditions that: (1) allow the United States to construct, operate, and maintain the Melvin Price Lock; (2) allow the Corporation to remove any improvements on its lands to be exchanged; and (3) allow the Secretary to require the Corporation to remove any such improvements. Requires the Corporation to pay the difference to the United States if the appraised fair market value of the land conveyed to the Corporation exceeds the appraised fair market value of the land conveyed to the United States by the Corporation.

titles.title: To authorize the exchange of certain Federal public land in Madison County, Illinois.
